answers.answer: Hi.  If you had diabetes since you were a child, you would have other symptoms other then excessive urination.   I don't know how to convert your weight in lbs (:    Other common symptoms are hunger, excessive but you gain weight.  Your test came out normal.  I would look into it more, for the reason. If your doctor won't please go to a urologist to see if there is a problem.   You know when I am anxious, which is often I tend to do the same thing.  Did your doctor have any suggestions?

Google Diabetes Insipidus. DI has to do with your kidneys not being able to retain/hold water. The doctor may order a urinalysis to check the chemical balance. Discuss with your doctor the treatments available. If possible get referred to a specialist, an Endocrinologist.

Hi,if all tests come back normal, this can be behavioral (ie you've learned and become accustomed to urinate all the time).  You may need to do something called bladder retraining to get your bladder stretched and used ot holding urine for a longer period.You could also ask to be referred to a urologist to make sure there is no medical cause.Hope this helps.

Thanks every one for your answers..To add some information..I have hypovitaminsis D condition and taking daily one tablet of Ezorb and calicel sachet twice a week.I think these vitamin D supplements also could be the problem..However i need to consult urologist to make sure these supplements are not damaging my kidneys..

question: I am 25 years Old,Male, 5'11" height and 62Kg weight.I have had excessive urination problem since childhood but recently from last six months this has increased.I always want to go for urine. Even with in a 30 min gap i feel like urinating.I diagnosed for diabetes checkup and it came out normal.What do you guys think and suggest?
title: Is Excessive urine sign of Diabetes
